item.title: The Little Tomb: The Maholova Club and the Search for a Dead Body launches September 10
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Coming-of-age adventure game dated.

Coming-of-age adventure game The Little Tomb: The Maholova Club and the Search for a Dead Body will launch for PC via Steam on September 10 for 1,400 yen, publisher PLAYISM and developer CAVYHOUSE announced. It will support English and Japanese language options. A demo is available now.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

“Is there a dead body who’d like to be buried in me?”

This is a coming-of-age adventure of a young boy who believes he’s an ancient Japanese tomb!

Key Features

  • Play as Kofun and go on an adventure to search for a dead body to bury in his body!
  • Complete tasks on your To-Do List to progress the story!
  • Interact with all sorts of things in your surroundings and collect Action Points!
  • Use Action Points to get new skills and hints for your adventure!

Characters

  • Kofun – A young boy who lives in Friendly Park. Believes he’s an ancient Japanese tomb. Thinks keyhole-shaped tombs are the coolest of them all.
  • Haniwa – A young funerary clay sculpture boy who’s always full of energy. He’s the one who first shows Kofun the outside world. Tends to get ahead of himself and act rashly.

Kofun grows throughout his journey as he gets to know all sorts of colorful characters.

Will he be able to find a dead body and become a proper tomb…?

Game Systems

In The Little Tomb: The Maholova Club and the Search for a Dead Body, you will control the protagonist Kofun. The story begins when you explore the playground he lives in.

Kofun can obtain Action Points by doing all sorts of different things.

Once you’ve gotten some Action Points, you can use them to get new skills or hints to help you solve puzzles you encounter along the way. Kofun is always learning!

Progress through the story and show Kofun a whole world of new experiences!

Let’s head out on an adventure to search for a dead body!

Watch a new trailer below.

Release Date Trailer

Japanese



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/09/the-little-tomb-the-maholova-club-and-the-search-for-a-dead-body-launches-september-10

item.title: Famitsu Review Scores: Issue 1913
item.content:encoded:
• PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2

Everybody's Golf: Hot Shots and more scored.

This week’s Famitsu review scores are in.

Thanks, Ryokutya2089.

item.title: Edia to port PC-Engine Ys, Dragon Slayer: The Legend of Heroes, and The Legend of Xanadu games to modern platforms
item.content:encoded:
Company enters into licensing agreement with Falcom.

Edia has entered into a global licensing agreement with Falcom to port various Ys, Dragon Slayer: The Legend of Heroes, and The Legend of Xanadu titles originally released for PC Engine CD-ROM² to modern platforms, the company announced.

The list of licensed titles is as follows:

  • Ys I & II (December 21, 1982, PC Engine CD-ROM²)
  • Ys III (March 22, 1991, PC Engine CD-ROM²)
  • Ys IV: The Dawn of Ys (December 22, 1993, PC Engine CD-ROM²)
  • Dragon Slayer: The Legend of Heroes (October 25, 1991, PC Engine CD-ROM²)
  • Dragon Slayer: The Legend of Heroes II (December 23, 1992, PC Engine CD-ROM²)
  • The Legend of Xanadu (February 18, 1994, PC Engine CD-ROM²)
  • The Legend of Xanadu II (June 30, 1995, PC Engine CD-ROM²)

The titles will be released between fiscal years 2026 and 2027, leveraging Edia’s expertise in porting and commercializing retro games—accumulated through releases like Telenet Shooting Collection and Valis: The Fantasm Soldier Collection—to deliver more than simple ports that can be enjoyed by many fans.

Further details regarding the product lineup will be announced at a later date.



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/09/edia-to-port-pc-engine-ys-dragon-slayer-the-legend-of-heroes-and-the-legend-of-xanadu-games-to-modern-platforms

item.title: KAMITSUBAKI CITY REGENERATE now available for PS4
item.content:encoded:
• PS4

Visual novel previously released for Switch, PC, iOS, and Android.

A PlayStation 4 version of science-fiction dark fantasy visual novel KAMITSUBAKI CITY REGENERATE is now available via PlayStation Store for $34.99 / £28.99 / €34.99 / ¥3,850, publisher and developer KAMITSUBAKI STUDIO, and developer Orange announced.

KAMITSUBAKI CITY REGENERATE first launched for Switch and PC via Steam on march 13, followed by iOS and Android on June 25.

Here is an overview of the game, via KAMITSUBAKI STUDIO:

About

In a world parallel to our own resides the city of Kamitsubaki.

One day, the player, an “Observer,” is summoned to this ill-fated world.

There, they meet a girl named Kafu, and set out on a quest with her to save the world from its impending doom.

Key Features

KAMITSUBAKI CITY REGENERATE is a dark-fantasy science fiction visual novel taking place in “Kamitsubaki City.”

The city is brought to life with stunning illustrations and fully-voiced characters, each with their own unique sprites.

The game possesses the most extensive story in the series that cuts straight to the heart of Kamitsubaki City, featuring numerous popular songs from Kamitsubaki’s vocal artists that link to the plot and expand the scale of the world’s lore.

The player’s choices in Kamitsubaki City weave the story in vastly different directions. Observe the tale unfold as you harmonize with the characters and music and bear witness to the city’s ultimate fate.

*This game and KAMITSUBAKI CITY VIRTUAL REALITY share the same basic story. Furthermore, the story is standalone, meaning those unfamiliar with the series can play these games with no worries.

What is the KAMITSUBAKI CITY UNDER CONSTRUCTION series?

An original intellectual property project by KAMITSUBAKI STUDIO in development since 2019.

One of multiple story projects whose lore is linked to the studio’s vocal artists, starting with tales centered around the parallel world of Kamitsubaki City.

Cast

  • Kafu Morisaki (voiced by KAF)
  • Rime Tanioki (voiced by RIM)
  • Haru Asanushi (voiced by Harusaruhi)
  • Sekai Yorukawa (voiced by Isekaijoucho)
  • Koko Rinne (voiced by KOKO)


https://www.gematsu.com/2025/09/kamitsubaki-city-regenerate-now-available-for-ps4

item.title: Rabi x Laby ‘final chapter production project’ announced
item.content:encoded:
CAMPFIRE crowdfunding campaign begins September 10.

Silver Star Japan has announced the launch of the Rabi x Laby “final chapter production project,” a project to conclude the unfinished story of the Rabi x Laby series in the form of a novel written by Etrange Overlord writer Roman Kitayama. A CAMPFIRE campaign will run from September 10 to October 24.

The novelization will dive deeper into the stories of the previous games, as well as bring the story to an end via the final chapter. A remake with additional stages, as well as a brand-new game based on the final chapter, will be produced if the campaign reaches certain stretch goals.

The Rabi x Laby story has been told over the past 15 years via the games Rabi x Laby, Rabi x Laby Episode 2, Rabi x Laby Episode 3, and Rabi x Laby Gaiden: Witch’s Cat. A collection including all four games, Rabi x Laby: Puzzle Out Stories, launched for PlayStation 4 and Switch on May 24, 2018 in Japan.

Here is the full list of campaign goals:

  • One million yen (base goal, approx. $6,720 USD) – Novelization of the first four games.
  • 1.5 million yen (approx. $10,080 USD) – Novelization of the new final chapter.
  • Two million yen (approx. $13,445 USD) – A remake with additional stages will be produced.
  • Three million yen (approx. $20,167 USD) – The remake will implement story parts from the novelization.
  • Four million yen (approx. $26,877 USD) – Adds full voice-overs.
  • Six million yen (approx. $40,316 USD) – Adds a voice drama.
  • 10 million yen (approx. $67,193 USD) – Adds a stage editor to freely create stages.

Silver Star Japan will also attend Tokyo Game Show 2025, which will run from September 25 to 28 at Makuhari Messe in Chiba, Japan, where the main visual for the final chapter production project will be on display, and previous Rabi x Laby games and Ginsei Shogi 10 will be playable.

Visit the project website here.



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/09/rabi-x-laby-final-chapter-production-project-announced

item.title: Nintendo 64 – Nintendo Classics adds FORSAKEN 64; Game Boy Advance – Nintendo Classics adds Magical Vacation in Japan
item.content:encoded:
• Switch
  • Switch 2

Latest classic game updates.

Nintendo 64 – Nintendo Classics has added Iguana UK-developed title FORSAKEN 64, Nintendo announced.

Additionally, Game Boy Advance – Nintendo Classics has added Brownie Brown-developed Magical Vacation in Japan.

Here is an overview of FORSAKEN 64, via the back of its box:

About

An experiment gone wrong ripped away the earths atmosphere. Bathed in the searing radiation of the sun, the planet has been condemned. You are among the FORSAKEN few who invade the now abandoned settlements to collect what little fortune was left behind.

Key Features

  • Advanced Particle Technology – Rolling boulders, falling ceilings, sucking turbine fans, giant piercing spikes, and more.
  • 25 Obliterating Weapons – Heat-seeking camera-mounted missiles; flame-spewing, petro-gel rifles; subversive bouncing mines; and more.
  • Furious Multiplayer Combat – With four-player split-screen.
  • 360 Degrees of Absolute Control – In any direction… for the ultimate 3D deathmatch.

Watch a new set of trailers below.

Nintendo 64 – Nintendo Classics – September 2025 Updates

Game Boy Advance – Nintendo Classics – September 2025 Updates



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/09/nintendo-64-nintendo-classics-adds-forsaken-64-game-boy-advance-nintendo-classics-adds-magical-vacation-in-japan

item.title: Annapurna Interactive announces TGS 2025 lineup, including three unannounced titles
item.content:encoded:
Unannounced titles to be revealed in the weeks leading up to the event.

Annapurna Interactive has announced its lineup for Tokyo Game Show 2025, which will run from September 25 to 28 at Makuhari Messe in Chiba, Japan, marking the first time the company will participate in the event.

At the Annapurna Interactive booth, attendees will have the opportunity to play three unannounced titles scheduled for release in 2026 and beyond, as well as the upcoming LEGO Voyagers, and the already-released STRAY and Outer Wilds.

The three unannounced titles will be revealed in the coming weeks just prior to Tokyo Game Show 2025.



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/09/annapurna-interactive-announces-tgs-2025-lineup-including-three-unannounced-titles
